title: Mayor of ogba
author: Mayor of ogba
content: As a newbie on this Bitcointalk forum, I wish to be guided by the high-rank members of this Bitcointalk forum on the type of posts I am to make that will not go against the Bitcointalk forum rules.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: Read the General Rules: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0It's pretty clear.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: Mayor of ogba on June 21, 2023, 02:54:02 PMAs a newbie on this Bitcointalk forum, I wish to be guided by the high-rank members of this Bitcointalk forum on the type of posts I am to make that will not go against the Bitcointalk forum rules.I'm  not one of the high-rank members but I could suggest you to avoid some basic mistakes that all newbies do (intentionally and unintentionally).Never post plagiarized content on BTTIf you do want to post plagiarized content then use Quotetags + provide the source linkNever Copy data from any AI content generator and paste it here.As a newbie do not abuse anyone even when you become high-member, you should not abuse anyoneTry not to start the same topics/threads which are already created here, create something unique and compelling so that, it is added as a contribution to BTTIf you are a newbie to crypto, then it would be hard for you to be active in topics that you do not understand, so without any knowledge, avoid posting replies, and do try to read as many replies as you can because that's how you will grow here.Do not be afraid to ask questions just like you did now, because when i was new to this platform i did not create my first topic until i come to understand which board is suitable for my content.Other than the above precautions, i would suggest you to read the provided rule thread by other members and do read this one too, these threads might seem to be so long but once you give them a read, you will see how important they were to remain here for longer period. Comprehensive guide to Bitcointalk. Newbie friendly + calculator and infographic

comments.author: Queentoshi
comments.body: If you are a newbie really to Bitcoins and the forum together, after reading the rules, it is expected for you to make the kind of post where you the intention is to know more, that is get more knowledge. A real newbie to Bitcoins should not be trying to act as if they already know what is being discussed. A newbie should be a newbie, knowing the rules of the forum will help you not to break them, knowing and accepting your position as a newbie will you to make newbie type of post that seeks to learn.

comments.author: BD Crypto
comments.body: Quote from: Mayor of ogba on June 21, 2023, 02:54:02 PMAs a newbie on this Bitcointalk forum, I wish to be guided by the high-rank members of this Bitcointalk forum on the type of posts I am to make that will not go against the Bitcointalk forum rules.Welcome to this Forum. Hope you already read the forum rules and if you don't read then have a look in it first Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQIf you already know about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies then you can discuss with others and create threads. If you need help or want to help others then always use Beginners & Help  board. Want to discuss about altcoins then go the Altcoin Discussion board and there are separated boards to discuss so follow them. To know about specific topics always use search option. To discuss in mother language always use your local board or thread.Anyway Don't Spam here and always try to write constructive posts and try to contribute in this forum.Best Wishes For You.

comments.body: Welcome to this forum, as long as you don't break any of those rules, you have nothing to worry about when you make a post or reply.Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ This Forum has been existing for over a decade and every old user where one time Newbie (since the time ranking was added) , there are alot of interesting topics that would be more helpful to Newbies and Ratimov did a compilation of the most important for beginners.Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: Mayor of ogba on June 21, 2023, 02:54:02 PMAs a newbie on this Bitcointalk forum, I wish to be guided by the high-rank members of this Bitcointalk forum on the type of posts I am to make that will not go against the Bitcointalk forum rules.Above all the recommendations from other members above... I will repeat some advice that was given to me when I first asked a curiosity question. The forum is too big, and it covers every aspect and field of specialization. So just choose where you think defines you the most and where you think you could possibly be useful. And start engaging in conversations there. Those things that you think you could possibly do in other social gatherings, you are free to do them here. There are no limitations to what could be posted; just don't steal others content, as mentioned by other members. The forum doesn't punish or victimize anyone for speaking their mind; everyone's opinion is respected and valued.

comments.author: alastantiger
comments.body: Quote from: Mayor of ogba on June 21, 2023, 02:54:02 PMAs a newbie on this Bitcointalk forum, I wish to be guided by the high-rank members of this Bitcointalk forum on the type of posts I am to make that will not go against the Bitcointalk forum rules.Make posts about:bitcoin news and recent happeningsTrading - share your experiences and ask questions.Economics -  share the latest happening in the economy of your country, the world in general. Make reference to bitcoin; compare and contrast. finance, the world of work. Share ideas, critique and so on.Technical discussion - If you are a crypto nerd, you can write about the more technical aspects of bitcoin.Beginners and Help: As the silly and non silly questions about bitcoin, the forum here.Gambling: Add your voice to on going sports and casino discussions.In all that you do, stay original with your ideas and respectful of others too.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: It doesn't matter what post as long as the quality of post is not low quality or spam posts then your good to go even if you are a newbie. The topic should be what you know instead of posting what you didn't know unless you are sharing a news or an article you found but make sure you include the link as reference so that you won't plagiarized the content of the article and won't get banned here in the forum because that's one of the forum rules.

comments.author: hatshepsut93
comments.body: A good way to start would be to apply your real world expertise that can be related to Bitcoin. If you know about economics, post about the relationship between the economy and Bitcoin. If you know about cybersecurity, discuss threats to Bitcoin users. However, I think your question has a flaw. If you already know what to post, you wouldn't ask it. And if you don't know, then it means you have nothing to say to this forum. If you are forcing yourself to write posts, then you are wasting your time.
